name: date
description: Display the current date and time, or format a specific date. Without arguments, prints the current date and time. Use +FORMAT to specify output format (e.g., +%Y-%m-%d for ISO date, +%s for Unix timestamp, +%H:%M for time). Use -d STRING to parse and display a specific date instead of now. Use for getting the current time, converting between date formats, or computing relative dates.

input.description: Optional format string or date specification as command arguments. No standard input required.

output.description: The formatted date and/or time string.
